Project.Brief history of your project and organi:
About AstroSynapse
AstroSynapse is a data organization dedicated to supporting scientific and research communities by curating and preserving valuable datasets. Our focus is on enabling open access, reproducibility, and long-term availability of benchmark and scientific data. By leveraging decentralized storage networks such as Filecoin, AstroSynapse ensures that critical datasets remain secure, distributed, and accessible to researchers worldwide.
Project.Describe the data being stored onto File:
We are storing the Graph500 benchmark dataset on Filecoin.
Graph500 is a well-known benchmark used to evaluate supercomputers on large-scale graph analytics tasks, such as breadth-first search (BFS) and single-source shortest path (SSSP). The dataset includes synthetic graph data generated using the Kronecker method at various scales, and is widely used in high-performance computing (HPC) research for testing and reproducibility.
Project.How do you plan to prepare the dataset: As the data preparer, AstroSynapse will retrieve the Graph500 benchmark datasets from their official sources. The files will be verified with checksums, organized by scale, and packaged into standardized archives (e.g., .tar.gz). Using open-source tools such as Python scripts and common Linux utilities, we will clean, structure, and split the data into suitable sizes. Finally, CAR files will be generated with the Lotus toolchain to enable efficient import and storage on the Filecoin network.
